explanations.unsupervised learning: The paper discusses clustering techniques (SemiNMF and Sparse-semiNMF) which are a part of unsupervised learning, as they do not rely on labeled data.
explanations.clustering: The paper explicitly mentions clustering stocks into latent trend based groupings using SemiNMF and Sparse-semiNMF techniques.
explanations.feature representation: The paper deals with low-rank approximate factorization techniques which are used to represent stocks in terms of latent trends, a form of feature representation.
explanations.representation learning: The use of factorization techniques (SemiNMF and Sparse-semiNMF) to uncover latent trends in stock data is a form of representation learning, as it aims to find a better representation of the data for the task of portfolio diversification.
